body.name: NEEWER Upgraded 80.7" Carbon Fiber Camera Tripod Monopod with Telescopic 2 Section Center Axes, 360° Panorama Ballhead, 1/4" Arca Type QR Plate, Travel Tripod with ø28mm Column, Max Load 26.5lb, N55CR
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tomorrow, February 14. Order within 24 mins
features: 【Carbon Fiber Travel Tripod】This camera tripod is strongly built with sturdy carbon fiber material. The thickened 28mm in diameter columns are capable of holding camera equipment weighing up to 26.5lb/12kg with optimal stability to prevent shaking. Its center column comes with an extra hook to hang sandbags for tripod balance and greater stability (sandbags not included)

【Easily Convertible Tripod/Monopod】The tripod/monopod in one design comes in handy for outdoor shooting, especially well suited for travel photography. When feeling tired, quickly remove the center column, detach one tripod leg, and connect them together for a make shift alpenstock or walking stick, ranging from 22.2”/56.5cm to 83.8”/213cm in height. A carrying bag also included for easy travel

【Extended Height with 2 Center Axes】Featuring 2 sections of telescopic center column, coupled with 4 sections of telescopic tripod legs, the video tripod reaches 80.7"/205cm in height at its maximum. With quick release twist locks, easily adjust the tripod to a desired height, minimum height 26.8"/68cm. The center column can also be inverted for low angle shooting and macro photography

【360° Swivel Ball Head for Panoramic Shots】The photography tripod comes with a larger than average 36mm ball head that swivels 360 degrees to provide for flexible filming angles while keeping your camera stable. 2 locking knobs enable precise control over camera movement for panoramic filming. The included 2 bubble level help keep the horizon straight

【Wide Compatibility with 1/4” Screw】The travel tripod is designed with a 1/4” quick release plate and 3 extra 1/4” screw holes, widely compatible with Canon Nikon Sony DSLR camera, camcorders, sports camera, and mirrorless camera, phone holder with 1/4" threaded screw hole (phone holder not included), and more. The carbon fiber build makes it compact and lightweight. Easily carry the tripod around for on the go photography

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good quality, lightweight, sturdy.
reviews.reviewText: Very good quality, stable, head works well but did need a little dry lubricant to smooth out. Extra height is nice when needed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best in class!!!
reviews.reviewText: Lightweight, very small to transport and stable when assembled! Very comfortable and easy to accommodate every situation.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love this tripod!
reviews.reviewText: Small packed size, very light and also sturdy. I use a Sigma 150-600 S and anyone else who has will say it's a heavy SOB. I attach a gimble head to this tripod and she's ready to go! Happy with this purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Not good for travel.
reviews.reviewText: It’s a great tripod. The leg locks are a bit finicky but you’ll get used to it. It’s a great tripod, sturdy, the fluid head could be better for panning. This is kinda heavy for travel. And it’s not advertised as a travel tripod.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: It’s heavy duty/heavy. My other ones weigh a few pounds. This is probably the weight of both put together. That is what I wanted. It’s sturdy. It’s all metal. (Minus the foot stops which are rubber). I was looking for a tripod to stand up to the wind out here. This is good enough I probably will not need to sand bag it. For reference I often have to fight 30+mph winds on a sunny day. I set it up last night in the wind on the porch and it didn’t budge. I don’t have to worry about it toppling over.Everything moves. It’s all adjustable. I will be able to multi use it with my teleprompter as well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I needed a light tripod for travel, and this is it
reviews.reviewText: I found this to be very solid and very stable. It is very light so using the hook to add weight is needed but I was very impressed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Excelente producto, es de buena calidad y llego dentro del tiempo estimado.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Overall this is a decent tripod and it has a lot going for it. The reason for the low rating is the lack of a handle. Changing direction or elevation requires holding the cameral and moving it. I would have liked a handle to accomlish those tasks. Another review said it was not smooth, and I agree with that assessment. I think a handle might help here, but I'm not sure. Put a handle on it and I would go 5 stars, Neewers higher end tripods have a handle, I guess this is one way to use carbon fiber and keep the cost down.

He realizado fotografía desde 2018 de manera asidua pero totalmente recreativa.Aun y cuando he hecho fotos como astro foto de espacio profundo , escaneado con camara negativos de 35mm. largas exposiciones, fotografias de concierto etc etc siemore habia utilizado un tripode de AMAZON BASICs. en ese lapso usé 4 tripodes hasta que ya me cansé y decidi invertir un poco mas de dinero en tripode. Escogó este ya que el precio se me hace algo caro pero acequible dado los materiales. fibra de carbono asi como la altura.. te da un maximo de 1.80m yo mido 1.77 asi que no llego a la altura maxima pero es genial porque ya no tengo que agacharme. Eso si, no lo recomiendo mucho ya que se pierde estabilidad.Este es mi pequeño resumen de las cosas buenas que le he visto.La funda esta genial !! es un poco acolchada y la correa es grueza que se siente muy bien al momento de cargar en hombros el tripode. Se agradece la funda... cuando pedí el producto la vdd no sabia que iba a venir con ella y fue una grata sorpresa.Los materiales son resistentes, las patas se sienten muy bien, la fibra te da mucha confianza un gran salto de calidad para mi ya que vengo de un producto de amazon basics de aluminio y plastico.La altura es genial ademas de la altura maxima, la altura minima tambien se agradece mucho. y puedes poneer la camara a raz de piso si es que inviertes el tubo del cabezal asi logras llegar practicamente al piso con una estabilidad genial.la altura minima con el cabezal en posicion correcta tambien se agradece para cuando hay qye hacer fotos de larga exposicion. Por la disposicion de las patas al momento de estar completamente extendidas logras una estabilidad mucho mayor lo que te da confianza para dejar la camara haciendo larga exposicion durante un buen tiempo. Creo que resiste ventiscas moderadas en esa posicion.En la altura media, con todas las patas extendidas al maximo tambien se siente resistente , el peso mismo del producto le da estabilidad, pero se podria mejorar colgando un contrapeso en el gancho incluido con el producto.El cabezal resiste muy bien los equipos fotograficos. Tengo una camara analogica mamiya 67 la cual es muy pesada pero el cabezal la resiste sin problemas en la posicion normal. no la he probado en la posicion de 45° pero yo creo que seria demaciado peso. Pero para una camara normal DSLR va mega sobrado. digamos una camara d750 con un 70-200mm quedaria sobradisimo. en la posicion Portrait.Los seguros en las patas dan mucha confianza y se agradece que hayan quitado las pinzas y hayan optado por el seguro tipo rosca.Se guarda rapidamente, los materiales se sienten de calidad. En verdad que ha sido un upgrade muy bueno que he tenido.Si vienes de un tripié del rango de < $1,000 pesos mexicanos < $70 dlls obviamente será una actualizacion enorme y quedarás satisfecho. Lo recomiendo. Editaré el comentario cuando tenga mas experiencias con el producto.

reviews.reviewTitle: This tripod is very strong, and yet very light to carry! Fantastic for photographers!
reviews.reviewText: I am so very impressed with the Neewer brand of photographic and videography equipment. I’ve been using the Neewer brand of equipment for the better part of a year now and I feel that most of their equipment and gear are at a professional grade level, but for a much better price tag than big brand names.This Neewer 80.7” Carbon Fiber Camera Tripod/ Monopod is no exception. It is professional all the way, being top quality. It has many features that I like, with the ball head, light weight, and ruggedness being the most important to me. It has a panning ring that works great for when taking panoramas. This tripod with this particular ball head is specifically designed for cameras being used for photography, not that it can’t be used for videography, but without a panning handle, it is meant more for photography. With this ball head and camera mount, you can tilt and angle your camera into positions that aren’t possible on standard, basic tripods that don’t have ball heads. Using the ball head adjustment knobs to position the camera is very intuitive.The tripod is very light and strong because it is made of carbon fiber. It is also compact and comes with a nice looking soft shell, padded carrying case and shoulder strap. Unlike some tripods, the Neewer Professional Camera tripod's legs move independently of each other. The legs have 3 angle adjustment positions that can be locked in using easy buttons. – See pictures• Low - legs almost lay flat out• Medium - legs are wide for stability• High - legs are more narrowly spread.The centre shaft can easily be inverted which is fantastic for very low-to-the-ground shots.An added feature that I very much enjoy about this tripod is that one of the legs can detach from the tripod to be converted into a Monopod! This feature is absolutely fantastic for my use! Another unexpected, but very cool feature is that the monopod leg can double as a walking stick!This is my favourite photography tripod and I am so happy that I ordered it. The price is very reasonable for the quality and features. I highly recommend “NEEWER Upgraded 80.7" Carbon Fiber Camera Tripod Monopod with Telescopic 2 Section Center Axes, and 360° Panorama Ball head”.Absolutely 5 stars from me!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 4, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I wish I had got this earlier! Excellent for its price, light weight, packs really small.I use a Canon R6, with 24-70 L Lens, Canon Flash gun, attached to a Manfrotto pro video head and found it reasonably steady.

reviews.reviewTitle: Seguro en la realización de las fotos.
reviews.reviewText: Es un trípode fuerte y alto. Se coloca fácilmente y tiene una mochila donde se mete el trípode. Precio/ calidad => buena.
